title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message:
No liquid damage. Before me someone tried to reflow smc

PP5V_S4RS3 pulses 2 times then stops.

PPBUS = 8.6V
G3H = 3.42V
PPVRTC = 3.3V
5V_S5 = 5V
3V3_S5 = 3.3V
3V3_SUS = 3.3V

title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message: If someone reflowed the SMC, there was very likely liquid damage somewhere at some point. Inspect for any signs of previous liquid near the TPS51980, U1900, U1950, U6100 and traces/resistors, JTAG connector etc.

title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message: Board looks very clean (only small amount of flux near smc). Forgot to mention that at first there was no light on charger because of bad flex cable (reason for smc reflow). SPI resistor and traces looks fine. When trying to bypass smc fan starts to spin for a few seconds.

title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message:
If board tries at least to start in SMC bypass, there should be an SMC sensor issue.
Check first SMC_AVREF voltage.
Post exact voltage for CHGR_A/BMON signals; pins 9 & 15 of U7100.

title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message:
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC = 3.3V
U7100 on pin 9 0.03V on pin 15 0v

title: 820-00165 No PP5V_S4RS3, green/orange light OK
message:
Check voltage on all coils when the board starts in SMC bypass mode.
Do you get something at CPU coils?
